court: IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY IN ITS INSOLVENCY JURISDICTION OFFICIAL ASSIGNEE'S REPORT NO. 132 OF 2006 IN PETITION NO.21 OF 1954 Re: Mulji Dubhash Shah ..Insolvent. Ex-parte : M/s. Matoomal Lalchand .. Petitioning Creditor. ... Mr. Y.C. Parikh, Official Assignee present. CORAM: DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD, J. 19th December, 2006. P.C. : An order of adjudication was passed on 1st June, 1954. The total proved liabilities are Rs.25,315.19. After declaring a dividend @ 100 paise in a rupee to preferential as well as unsecured creditors, there is a balance of Rs.26,462.95 lying against the estate of the Insolvent. The Official Assignee seeks to declare interest @ 6% under Section 49(6) of the Presidency Towns Insolvency Act, 1909. The Assignee has also sought a direction that thereafter the insolvency may be annulled since all the claims have been met. The report is made absolute in terms of prayer clauses (a) and (b).
